title: inelasticsupply
author: inelasticsupply
content: CASASCIUS IN ANACS HOLDERS: .1, .5 (brass), 1 (brass or gilt). Something of decent quality - no big black spots on brass coins. Willing to pay fair but not "pry it from your hands" price. Your coin, you set the price. I'm not afraid to be patient if this inquiry is not fruitful.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Anything too vintage to trade? Vintage BTCC, Lealana etc? I have a few in your wish list ANACS slabbed. Not really looking to sell, but open to trades.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: inelasticsupply on December 15, 2023, 03:51:15 PMCASASCIUS IN ANACS HOLDERS: .1, .5 (brass), 1 (brass or gilt). Something of decent quality - no big black spots on brass coins. Willing to pay fair but not "pry it from your hands" price. Your coin, you set the price. I'm not afraid to be patient if this inquiry is not fruitful. I have a few 1 BTC Casascius coins that I’d let go for the right price. If I’m setting the price it would be 1.35 BTC for the latest brass Casascius coin, but of course there’s always room to negotiate.  Any idea what you’re willing to pay for the right specimen? I’d also require payment up front. Good luck with your hunt. They’re out there.
